LCE3C_LCE3B-del shows epistatic effects with the HLA-Cw6 allele on the development of psoriasis.

study confirms the recently published finding that the deletion of the two LCE genes is a susceptibility factor for psoriasis vulgaris with dosage effect
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
we have verified a pleiotropic effect of a common genetic risk factor (LCE3C_LCE3B-del) for autoimmune diseases that is involved in both psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
work suggested that homozygosity for a common LCE3C_LCE3B deletion contributes to the risk of developing chronic plaque type Psoriasis without psoriatic arthritis
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
no genetic association between LCE3B and LCE3C deletions and atopic dermatitis
Meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
the deletion of LCE3C and LCE3B is a common genetic factor for susceptibility to psoriasis in the European, Chinese and Mongolian populations.
LCE3C_LCE3B deletion is a susceptibility factor for Psoriatic arthritis, confirming the existence of a shared risk factor involving the epidermal skin barrier in autoimmune disorders.
LCE3B/C deletion may have a role in psoriasis
Our study confirms an association between the deletion of LCE3C and LCE3B and psoriasis in a Chinese population.

This study provides evidence for an association between LCE3C_LCE3B-del and RA in non-Caucasian populations, and SNPs rs4112788 and rs4085613 tagging LCE3C_LCE3B-del were novel susceptibility factors for SLE.

The findings indicate that the LCE3C_LCE3B-del is an important risk factor in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and that the LCE3C_LCE3B-del does not show an epistatic effect with the HLA-Cw6 allele on susceptibility to psoriasis in the northern Chinese
A deletion of LCE3B and LCE3C genes may promote the development of allergic contact dermatitis
results suggest that the Koebner phenomenon in psoriasis is unlikely to be dependent on the LCE3B/C genotype
LCE3C_LCE3B-del is a common risk factor for (auto)immune diseases
Paediatric-onset psoriasis is associated with .......... LCE3C_LCE3B deletion
The LCE3C_LCE3B-del might play a role in familial psoriasis in the Tunisian population.
Our meta-analysis demonstrates a significant association between psoriasis and the LCE3C_LCE3B-del polymorphism in Europeans and Asians, but no association with psoriatic arthritis.
No evidence of association was seen between the LCE3C_LCE3B-del and psoriasis in 34 patients from 7 multiplex Tunisian families. No epistasic effect was found between the deletion and PSORS1 locus.
Our data suggest that The LCE deletion, previously identified in patients with psoriasis, is not of a major importance in the development of PsA in Tunisian patients
